_exec_summary.SummaryText:
PDX Pipeline Co operates a natural gas liquids recovery facility, the Reno Gas Processing Plant, near Turon, Kansas. The plant is designed to recover liquid products from natural gas via physical separation, dehydration, refrigeration, and expansion. Petroleum condensates and natural gas liquids are recovered from the inlet pipeline gas.  Section 112(r) of the Clean Air Act applies to the Reno plant because it handles and stores process flammables such as methane, ethane, propane, butane, isobutane, pentane and isopentane in excess of threshold quantities. PDX Pipeline Co management is aware of potential hazards posed by processing and storing natural gas and natural gas liquids. Programs are being established to prevent accidental releases and train personnel for emergency response in the event of a release. 

PDX Pipeline Co has considered the impact of a "worst case" accident.  In this case, the "worst case" would be a complete release from the 42,000 gallon NGL storage tank, resulting in the instantaneous formation of a vapor cloud which ignites and explodes. Using the EPA's RMP*Comp software version 1.07, the potential radius of impact, due to the explosion, was calculated to extend 0.5 miles. MarPlot was utilized to estimate public receptors within a 1 mile radius.  It was determined that there are no public receptors within the 0.5 mile radius.  A consideration of the 0.5 mile radius has been incorporated into our notification and emergency response planning.

PDX Pipeline Co is implementing safety programs and procedures designed to prevent and mitigate catastrophic releases. Operation, maintenance, training, and inspection procedures are being implemented.  In addition, PDX Pipeline Co will coordinate with local emergency responders, including the Reno Volunteer Fire Department, and the Local Emergency Planning Committee. Reno Plant personnel and responders will be required to participate in facility-specific training.

With these objectives in mind, this R

isk Management Plan has been developed to provide information about our management of risks associated with natural gas treatment and liquids recovery.  We stress our commitment to ensuring a safe operation for our employees, our visitors, and our community.
